CIRCULAR 2005 (CIRCULAR) 
NO.CAS-7(22)/2004/Div.I 
BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
A WING , JANPATH  BHAWAN , 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI -110001 
Date : 01.6.2005 
 
 
CIRCULAR  NO. 19/2005 
 
 
It has been observed that crowd of visitors/passengers gather in front of the terminal 
building during peak hours. Such crowd can be targeted by the terrorist outfits either by 
exploding the IED or indiscriminate firing. It is, therefore, necessary that this area alongwith 
other security controlled areas in the departure hall should be covered by adequate 
surveillance by trained security personnel particularly during peak hours to prevent any such 
crimes at the airport. 
 
At metro airports i.e. Delhi/ Mumbai/ Kolkata/ Chennai, BCAS sniffer dogs can be 
utilized for patrolling inside / outside of terminal building during peak hours. This will not 
only help the surveillance staff to detect the suspicious elements but also have deterring 
effect at the airport. 
 
The above directions shall be implemented with immediate effect. 
 
 
 
( R C Tayal ) 
Offg. Commissioner of  Security(CA)
